Articles.Content:
Welcome to Purple Ink Aeronauticals, founded by Jedrod Kerman, the famous Professor of Space and Stuff at the USK space program.

But first, here is V1 of our Purple Ink Care Package!

https://copy.com/VVH6eF6rqoToptTK

^^ THIS IS NEEDED! ^^

Okay, we need to get one thing out of the way. We do not make full rockets, we instead make sub-assemblies to add on to your rockets.

Now then, down to business!

"Indigo" Lander

I apologize for the bad graphics, I am not that good with GIMP.

Non-SAS: https://copy.com/it1Ply1xYzOJZV8G

SAS: https://copy.com/dpggW0kGBSFzVZrI

Please give feedback!

-Purple Ink Aeronauticals

Kopyright Purple Ink Aeronauticals 2014

Edited November 4, 2014 by lordmuffin

Could use the smaller legs or the smaller parachute on the lander.

It's a bit heavy otherwise.

P.S. That background, it hurts us!

EDIT: The problem I see with sharing outright subassemblies is that it's often just faster to make them as you go than to download it and place it correctly.

Outright launch platforms by tonnage, that's something I'd get behind but I'm sure it's nothing new.

P.P.S. I think you meant to post this in the Rocket Builder sub-forum, maybe?

Edited November 4, 2014 by Axelord FTW
